metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16012 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Side-channel information leakage in graphics in Google Chrome prior to 87.0.4280.66 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
